com.berbils.game.Entities.Towers

Class Tower

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity
      • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.CircleGameEntity
        • com.berbils.game.Entities.Towers.Tower

  • public class Tower
extends CircleGameEntity
    Creates a tower game object, an enemy object that attacks if the player gets within a set range

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private float currentHealth
      The current health of the tower, once this reaches zero the tower "dies" and the onDeath() method is called
      private com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body currentTarget
      The current target for teh tower to fire at, if null the tower is automatically set to not active
      private java.lang.String disengagedTowerTextureFP
      The file path to the texture for when the tower does not have a target
      private java.lang.String engagedTowerTextureFP
      The file path to the texture for when the tower has a target
      private Explosion explosionOnDeath
      The explosion class object used to create an explosion upon tower death
      private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite healthBar
      The sprite for the healthbar displaed above the tower
      private com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 healthBarPos
      The position of the healthBar in meters
      private com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 healthBarSize
      The size of the healthbar in meters
      private boolean isActive
      The boolean for telling the tower whether it has a target and can fire (if also alive), also used for determining which texture the tower needs currently.
      private boolean isAlive
      Boolean for determining whether the fire engine is alive or not alive and should be destroyed
      private float maxHealth
      The max health for the Tower instance and represents the maximum amount of damage the Tower can take before death
      private float range
      The range that the tower can attack within, in meters
      private CircleGameEntity towerSensor
      The tower sensor, a circle sensor the size of the tower range, it is used for determining whether a target is within a certain distance of the tower and can therefore be attacked
      private Weapon towerWeapon
      The weapon object the tower will use to spawn projectiles

      • Fields inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity

        catBits, entityBody, entityBodyDefinition, entityFixture, entityFixtureDefinition, entityShape, entitySprite, isStatic, maskBits, position, screen, sizeDims, spriteHandler, spriteLayer, userData, world

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tower(float diameter, float range, int maxHealth, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 pos, PlayScreen screen, Weapon weapon, java.lang.String textureFilePathDisengaged, java.lang.String textureFilePathEngaged)
      Creates the tower base body, fixture and sprite.Also creates the tower sensor body and fixture in addition to variable assignment.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void createHealthBar()
      Creats the health bar sprite
      private void createSensor()
      Creates a circle entity with no sprite and sets it to be a sensor, this will be what detects players coming within range
      private void defineStats(float range, float diam, int maxHealth, java.lang.String textureFPDisengaged, java.lang.String textureFPEngaged)
      Assign tower variables
      void fire()
      If the tower is alive and can fire, it fires a projectile towards a target
      void onDeath()
      Called upon tower death Updates the screen counter for towers alive If the tower is the last one alive the game screen is updated to the game won screen Else if the tower is not the last one alive, an explosion is created and the towers body, fixture and sprite destroyed.
      private void setActive(boolean active)
      Sets the tower state, inactive means it can not fire, active means it can
      void setTarget(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body target)
      Sets the target for the tower to fire at
      void setWeapon(Weapon weapon)
      Setter for the towers weapon, also sets the weapons collision filtering
      void takeDamage(int damageTaken)
      The amount of damage taken from being hit by a projectile
      void update(float deltaTime)
      The update method needs to be called every world update:The health bar is updated and any explosions caused by the death of the tower are updated to go away after a set amount of time via this

      • Methods inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.CircleGameEntity

        defineBox2DEntity, getSizeDims

      • Methods inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • towerWeapon

        private Weapon towerWeapon
        The weapon object the tower will use to spawn projectiles

      • isActive

        private boolean isActive
        The boolean for telling the tower whether it has a target and can fire (if also alive), also used for determining which texture the tower needs currently.

      • isAlive

        private boolean isAlive
        Boolean for determining whether the fire engine is alive or not alive and should be destroyed

      • currentTarget

        private com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body currentTarget
        The current target for teh tower to fire at, if null the tower is automatically set to not active

      • engagedTowerTextureFP

        private java.lang.String engagedTowerTextureFP
        The file path to the texture for when the tower has a target

      • disengagedTowerTextureFP

        private java.lang.String disengagedTowerTextureFP
        The file path to the texture for when the tower does not have a target

      • towerSensor

        private CircleGameEntity towerSensor
        The tower sensor, a circle sensor the size of the tower range, it is used for determining whether a target is within a certain distance of the tower and can therefore be attacked

      • range

        private float range
        The range that the tower can attack within, in meters

      • currentHealth

        private float currentHealth
        The current health of the tower, once this reaches zero the tower "dies" and the onDeath() method is called

      • maxHealth

        private float maxHealth
        The max health for the Tower instance and represents the maximum amount of damage the Tower can take before death

      • healthBar

        private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite healthBar
        The sprite for the healthbar displaed above the tower

        The position of the healthBar in meters

        private com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 healthBarSize
        The size of the healthbar in meters

      • explosionOnDeath

        private Explosion explosionOnDeath
        The explosion class object used to create an explosion upon tower death

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tower

        public Tower(float diameter,
             float range,
             int maxHealth,
             com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 pos,
             PlayScreen screen,
             Weapon weapon,
             java.lang.String textureFilePathDisengaged,
             java.lang.String textureFilePathEngaged)
        Creates the tower base body, fixture and sprite.Also creates the tower sensor body and fixture in addition to variable assignment.
        Parameters:
        diameter - The diameter of the tower base in meters
        range - The range of the tower in meters (The * size of the tower sensor entity)
        maxHealth - The max health for the Tower instance and represents the maximum amount of damage the Tower can take before death
        pos - The position of the tower in meters
        screen - The screen the tower will be created in
        weapon - The weapon object the tower will use to spawn projectiles
        textureFilePathDisengaged - The file path for the texture for when the tower does not have a target in range
        textureFilePathEngaged - The file path for the texture for when the tower does have a target in range

    • Method Detail

      • defineStats

        private void defineStats(float range,
                         float diam,
                         int maxHealth,
                         java.lang.String textureFPDisengaged,
                         java.lang.String textureFPEngaged)
        Assign tower variables
        Parameters:
        range - The range of the tower in meters (The size of the tower sensor entity)
        diam - The diameter of the tower base in meters
        maxHealth - The max health for the fire engine instance and represents the maximum amount of damage the fire engine can take before death
        textureFPDisengaged - The file path for the texture for when the tower does not have a target in range
        textureFPEngaged - The file path for the texture for when the tower does have a target in range

      • createSensor

        private void createSensor()
        Creates a circle entity with no sprite and sets it to be a sensor, this will be what detects players coming within range

      • setWeapon

        public void setWeapon(Weapon weapon)
        Setter for the towers weapon, also sets the weapons collision filtering
        Parameters:
        weapon - The weapon the Tower will use to spawn projectiles

      • createHealthBar

        private void createHealthBar()
        Creats the health bar sprite

      • fire

        public void fire()
        If the tower is alive and can fire, it fires a projectile towards a target

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int damageTaken)
        The amount of damage taken from being hit by a projectile
        Parameters:
        damageTaken - The amount of damage to deal to the towers health

      • onDeath

        public void onDeath()
        Called upon tower death Updates the screen counter for towers alive If the tower is the last one alive the game screen is updated to the game won screen Else if the tower is not the last one alive, an explosion is created and the towers body, fixture and sprite destroyed.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body target)
        Sets the target for the tower to fire at
        Parameters:
        target - the target Box2D body to attack/fire at

      • setActive

        private void setActive(boolean active)
        Sets the tower state, inactive means it can not fire, active means it can
        Parameters:
        active - true = The tower can fire, False = The tower can not fire

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        The update method needs to be called every world update:The health bar is updated and any explosions caused by the death of the tower are updated to go away after a set amount of time via this
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The time in seconds that have elapsed in world time (Excludes time taken to draw, render etc) since the last Gdx delta call.
